overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. LinkedIn has the largest follower base, but engagement varies across platforms. The content focuses on research updates, job postings, and conference announcements.

contentThemes.description: Updates on research projects, publications, and methods related to computational social science.
Discussion and analysis of disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms.
Announcements of job openings, postdoc positions, and PhD research opportunities.
Information related to presentations and participation in conferences related to disinformation and social media.

recommendations: Increase posting frequency, especially on Mastodon, to maintain audience engagement.
Utilize platform-specific content strategies: more professional/formal content on LinkedIn, more community-focused content on Mastodon, and mixed content on Bluesky.
Incorporate visuals (images, videos) in posts to increase engagement.
Actively engage with followers by responding to comments and questions.
Use relevant hashtags to increase the reach of posts.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a good balance of research updates and opportunities, suggesting a strong academic and research-oriented community.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon posts focus on research and discussions, indicating a niche audience interested in the technical aspects of social media analysis. Lower engagement rate compared to other platforms.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is the professional platform with the largest follower base. Content related to job opportunities and grant announcements perform well.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.

Now hiring: Two postdoctoral researchers to join our team working on computational methods for social media analysis. Background in data science, computational social science, or related fields preferred.
